SEARCH
Package com.kneelawk.knet.api.util

Class NetRegistryByteBuf

java.lang.Object
io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf
net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf
net.minecraft.network.RegistryFriendlyByteBuf
com.kneelawk.knet.api.util.NetRegistryByteBuf
All Implemented Interfaces:
NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>, io.netty.buffer.ByteBufConvertible, io.netty.util.ReferenceCounted, Comparable<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf>
public class NetRegistryByteBuf extends net.minecraft.network.RegistryFriendlyByteBuf implements NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
Special FriendlyByteBuf that is like a RegistryNetByteBuf but that extends RegistryFriendlyByteBuf instead of NetByteBuf.

Class hierarchy: 

               FriendlyByteBuf
                 /         \
   RegistryFriendlyByteBuf      NetByteBuf
              |               |
 NetRegistryByteBuf<->RegistryNetByteBuf
See Also:
  • NetByteBuf
  • RegistryFriendlyByteBuf
  • RegistryNetByteBuf

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.kneelawk.knet.api.util.NetBuf

    NetBuf.SavedReaderIndex

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    final boolean
    passthrough
    If true then all FriendlyByteBuf override methods that this NetByteBuf optimises will instead just write using the normal minecraft methods, rather than the (potentially) optimised versions.

    DEFAULT_NBT_QUOTA, MAX_COMPONENT_STRING_LENGTH, MAX_STRING_LENGTH

  • Field Details

    • passthrough

      public final boolean passthrough
      If true then all FriendlyByteBuf override methods that this NetByteBuf optimises will instead just write using the normal minecraft methods, rather than the (potentially) optimised versions.

    • NetRegistryByteBuf

      public NetRegistryByteBuf(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf wrapped, net.minecraft.core.RegistryAccess registryManager, boolean passthrough)
      Creates a new NetRegistryByteBuf.
      Parameters:
      wrapped - the buffer to wrap.
      registryManager - the registry manager for this buffer.
      passthrough - whether to disable optimizations.

    • copy

      public NetRegistryByteBuf copy()
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Returns a copy of this buffer's readable bytes. Modifying the content of the returned buffer or this buffer does not affect each other at all. This method is identical to buf.copy(buf.readerIndex(), buf.readableBytes()). This method does not modify readerIndex or writerIndex of this buffer.
      Specified by:
      copy in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Overrides:
      copy in class net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf
      Returns:
      a copy of this buffer.

    • readBytes

      public NetRegistryByteBuf readBytes(int length)
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Transfers this buffer's data to a newly created buffer starting at the current readerIndex and increases the readerIndex by the number of the transferred bytes (= length). The returned buffer's readerIndex and writerIndex are 0 and length respectively.

      Note: this will not carry partial reads over to the returned buffer.

      Specified by:
      readBytes in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Overrides:
      readBytes in class net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf
      Parameters:
      length - the number of bytes to transfer
      Returns:
      the newly created buffer which contains the transferred bytes

    • clear

      public NetRegistryByteBuf clear()
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Sets the readerIndex and writerIndex of this buffer to 0 while resetting the partial byte data.

      Please note that the behavior of this method is different from that of NIO buffer, which sets the limit to the capacity of the buffer.

      Specified by:
      clear in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Overrides:
      clear in class net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • markReaderIndex

      public NetRegistryByteBuf markReaderIndex()
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Marks the current readerIndex in this buffer. You can reposition the current readerIndex to the marked readerIndex by calling NetBuf.resetReaderIndex(). The initial value of the marked readerIndex is 0.
      Specified by:
      markReaderIndex in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Overrides:
      markReaderIndex in class net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • writeBoolean

      public NetRegistryByteBuf writeBoolean(boolean flag)
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Writes a single boolean out to some position in this buffer. The boolean flag might be written to a new byte (increasing the writerIndex) or it might be added to an existing byte that was written with a previous call to this method.
      Specified by:
      writeBoolean in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Overrides:
      writeBoolean in class net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      this buffer.

      public boolean readBoolean()
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf

      Specified by:

    • writeVarInt

      public NetRegistryByteBuf writeVarInt(int ival)
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Writes out an integer using a variable number of bytes.
      • 1 byte for NetBuf.MIN_VAR_S_INT_1_BYTE to NetBuf.MAX_VAR_S_INT_1_BYTE
      • 2 bytes for NetBuf.MIN_VAR_S_INT_2_BYTES to NetBuf.MAX_VAR_S_INT_2_BYTES
      • 3 bytes for NetBuf.MIN_VAR_S_INT_3_BYTES to NetBuf.MAX_VAR_S_INT_3_BYTES
      • 4 bytes for NetBuf.MIN_VAR_S_INT_4_BYTES to NetBuf.MAX_VAR_S_INT_4_BYTES
      • 5 bytes for Integer.MIN_VALUE to Integer.MAX_VALUE

      Unlike vanilla this doesn't use 5 bytes for all negative numbers.

      Specified by:
      writeVarInt in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Overrides:
      writeVarInt in class net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf
      Parameters:
      ival - the integer value to write.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • readVarInt

      public int readVarInt()
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Reads out an integer using a variable number of bytes, assuming it was written by NetBuf.writeVarInt(int)
      Specified by:
      readVarInt in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Overrides:
      readVarInt in class net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf
      Returns:
      the read variable-length integer.

    • writeVarUnsignedInt

      public NetRegistryByteBuf writeVarUnsignedInt(int ival)
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Exposes the vanilla method for writing out an unsigned integer using a variable number of bytes.
      • 1 byte for NetBuf.MIN_VAR_U_INT_SMALL to NetBuf.MAX_VAR_S_INT_1_BYTE
      • 2 bytes for NetBuf.MIN_VAR_U_INT_SMALL to NetBuf.MAX_VAR_S_INT_2_BYTES
      • 3 bytes for NetBuf.MIN_VAR_U_INT_SMALL to NetBuf.MAX_VAR_S_INT_3_BYTES
      • 4 bytes for NetBuf.MIN_VAR_U_INT_SMALL to NetBuf.MAX_VAR_S_INT_4_BYTES
      • 5 bytes for Integer.MIN_VALUE to Integer.MAX_VALUE

      Unlike NetBuf.writeVarInt(int) this only uses less than 5 bytes for non-negative integers less than pow(2, 8 * 3 - 1) ()

      Specified by:
      writeVarUnsignedInt in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Parameters:
      ival - the unsigned integer value to write.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

    • readVarUnsignedInt

      public int readVarUnsignedInt()
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Exposes the vanilla method for reading an unsigned integer using a variable number of bytes.

      Unlike NetBuf.readVarInt() this only uses less than 5 bytes for non-negative integers less than pow(2, 8 * 3 - 1) ()

      Specified by:
      readVarUnsignedInt in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Returns:
      the read unsigned integer value.

    • writeVarLong

      public NetRegistryByteBuf writeVarLong(long lval)
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Writes out a long integer using a variable number of bytes.
      • 1 byte for -64 to 63
      • 2 bytes for -8,192 to 8,191
      • 3 bytes for -1,048,576 to 1,048,575
      • 4 bytes for -134,217,728 to 134,217,727

      Unlike vanilla this doesn't use 9 bytes for all negative numbers.

      Specified by:
      writeVarLong in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Overrides:
      writeVarLong in class net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf
      Parameters:
      lval - the long integer value to write.
      Returns:
      this buffer.

      Overrides:

    • readIdentifierOrNull

      @Nullable public @Nullable net.minecraft.resources.ResourceLocation readIdentifierOrNull()
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Like FriendlyByteBuf.readResourceLocation(), but returns null instead of throwing an error if the read string was invalid.

      Note: this will attempt to read a string from the buffer regardless of whether that string is a valid ResourceLocation.

      Specified by:
      readIdentifierOrNull in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Returns:
      the valid identifier read, or null if the read string did not represent a valid identifier.

    • readUtf

      public String readUtf()
      Description copied from interface: NetBuf
      Reads a string of up to Short.MAX_VALUE length.

      NOTE: This is just FriendlyByteBuf.readUtf() but available on the server as well.

      Specified by:
      readUtf in interface NetBuf<NetRegistryByteBuf>
      Overrides:
      readUtf in class net.minecraft.network.FriendlyByteBuf
      Returns:
      the read string.
